Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Two drops
Description: These two pieces represent two drops of water made of blue enamel, one being darker than the other. Both of them are hollow. The first one (a), the largest one, measures 2,3 cm and its maximum diametre is 1,6 cm. It is made of an intense blue enamel. The second one (b) is smaller: 1,85 cm high and 1,4 cm maximum in diametre. The use of these two pieces has not been determined. They may be decorative elements of a labret or an earring.
